extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 15 jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, cut into 2-inch x 1/2-inch x 1/4-inch strips

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese-Stuffed Jalapenos

winePairing.pairingText: Chili works really well with Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. You could try Poema Brut Cava. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Poema Brut Cava
productMatches.description: Vibrant aromas of ripe peaches, pears and toasted bread with a hint of spice fill the nose. The palate is dry with a rich, creamy texture. Layers of flavor include orange rind and spice that persists through an elegant finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Place a cheese strip in each pepper half; sprinkle with bread crumbs and bacon.                                                                                            Grill peppers, covered, over medium-hot heat for 4-6 minutes or until peppers are tender and cheese is melted. Serve warm.                                    Yield: 2-1/2 dozen.                                                                                                     Editor's Note: Wear disposable gloves when cutting hot peppers; the oils can burn skin. Avoid touching your face.                                                                                                Originally published as Cheese-Stuffed Jalapenos in  Simple & DeliciousJuly/August 2008, p61                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 stuffed pepper equals 38 calories, 3 g fat (2 g saturated fat), 7 mg cholesterol, 87 mg sodium, 1 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 2 g protein. Diabetic Exchange: 1/2 fat.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Place a cheese strip in each pepper half; sprinkle with bread crumbs and bacon.
Grill peppers, covered, over medium-hot heat for 4-6 minutes or until peppers are tender and cheese is melted.
